intro: Humboltia expansa, commonly known as the yellow balm of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Humboltia expansa is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
